summary: This is a March 3, 2020 letter from the law firm WilmerHale to the U.S. Attorney's Office, transmitting JPMorgan Chase's production of financial records in response to grand jury subpoenas related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter includes a detailed appendix listing numerous bank accounts and entities associated with Epstein, Maxwell, and related parties, and requests confidential treatment for the materials.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Attorney from Wilmer Cutler Pickering Hale and Dorr LLP who signed the letter submitting JPMorgan Chase's document production to the U.S. Attorney's Office in response to grand jury subpoenas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the grand jury investigation and subpoenas. Numerous bank accounts and entities (e.g., Epstein Interests, JEGE INC, Southern Trust Company) are listed under his name and the 'JE DM' header.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the grand jury investigation and subpoenas. Multiple personal and corporate accounts (e.g., Max Foundation, Terra Mar Project) are listed under her name.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Listed as a contact (c/o New York Strategy Group) for a Jeffrey Epstein account. Multiple accounts are listed under his name and his law firm (Darren K Indyke PLLC, Darren R Indyke PLLC) in the 'JE DM' accounts section.

connections.description: Financial accounts are co-mingled or overlapping, as indicated by the 'JE DM & Maxwell Accounts' section in the appendix, which includes entities like Max Foundation and 116 EAST 65TH ST LLC.

Darren Indyke is listed as the contact for a Jeffrey Epstein account, and his law firm's accounts are categorized under the 'JE DM' (Jeffrey Epstein Designated Matters) header, indicating a professional legal and financial relationship.
JPMorgan Chase was the financial institution holding numerous accounts for Jeffrey Epstein, his entities, and associates, and is producing these records under subpoena.
JPMorgan Chase was the financial institution holding numerous accounts for Ghislaine Maxwell and her entities, and is producing these records under subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoenas Issued to JPMorgan
events.description: Grand jury subpoenas were issued to JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., Chase Bank USA, N.A., and J.P. Morgan Securities LLC.

events.title: Additional Grand Jury Subpoenas
events.description: Additional grand jury subpoenas were issued to JP Morgan Chase.

events.title: Additional Grand Jury Subpoenas
events.description: Additional grand jury subpoenas were issued to JP Morgan Chase.

events.title: Initial Document Production
events.description: JPMorgan Chase made an initial production of documents in response to the subpoenas.

events.title: Submission of Encrypted Financial Records
events.description: WilmerHale, on behalf of JPMorgan Chase, submitted an encrypted disc containing a massive production of financial account statements (over 50,000 pages) to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office address: One St. Andrew's Plaza)
New York, New York 10007 (WilmerHale office address: 7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich Street)
keyFacts: JPMorgan Chase produced a vast trove of financial records (Bates JPM-SDNY-00003382 through JPM-SDNY-00054724) related to Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and associated entities in response to federal grand jury subpoenas.

The production includes account statements categorized under 'Epstein Accounts,' 'Epstein & JE DM Accounts,' 'JE DM Accounts,' 'JE DM & Maxwell Accounts,' and 'Maxwell Accounts,' revealing a complex web of financial entities.

The 'JE DM' (Jeffrey Epstein Designated Matters) accounts include entities and accounts associated with Epstein's attorney, Darren Indyke, and his law firm, indicating their deep involvement in Epstein's financial affairs.

The law firm WilmerHale formally requested confidential treatment for all produced materials under FOIA Exemptions 4 and 7, arguing disclosure would cause competitive harm and interfere with law enforcement proceedings.

The appendix lists dozens of corporate entities and trusts (e.g., Air Ghislaine Inc, Hyperion Air, Southern Trust Company, The Haze Trust, Terra Mar Project) used by Epstein and Maxwell, mapping the structure of their financial operations.
